page.title: 07ASCOT VINEYARD
page.content: Ascot Vineyard is situated on Crown lands next to the Racecourse.It forms part of Ascot Farm on Sunninghill Park.The 4,000 vines were laid down in 1979 and are 7 varieties of French and German origin.They thrive on the light soil of the district and the longer days and lower average temperature of the English Summer.The first Ascot vintage (red and white wine) was harvested in October 1983.They feature in the most prestigious hotels and clubs in London and the Home Counties. It is believed to be the first commercial vineyard established on the Crown Lands since Henry II who added Bordeaux to his kingdom in the 12th Century.
